there is room for both free and proprietary software me thinks
and yes, what Quest-Master said
: but If wanted to open a startup developing bespoke software for others ( businesses ) -- whats the business model?
the business model is definitely changing -- people are *not* going to pay for all software anymore.  Those days are gone IMO
Then how does one make money from it.. By money I mean a profitable business.
you need to seek a niche, a specialized software product where there is no free software that can do the same job...
at the same time, you look to providing programming *service*, instead of just trying to sell/clone your code for profit
but honestly I don't really think there is a problem because free software gives everyone (including you :-) the tools to program stuff for people who will pay you to do it...
I am a firm supporter of free software BTW -- people should not have to be ripped off by some foreign (to me) wannabee monopoly corporation just to check their email ;-)
